snifc.sensor
Interface IOPortsIfc

public interface IOPortsIfc

The IOPortsIfc represents connexion the Sensor has with the outside world (through links) The IOPortIfc enables the sensor to send and receive packet through links.

Author:
sfrenot - 2004

Method Summary
 void addLink(LinkIfc l)
          That method is used to create a new connexion between the IOPorts and a link.
 void getPackets()
          That methods treats all incoming packets on the link.
 void writePacket(PacketIfc p)
          That methods is called by the sensor when he wants to write the next packet on the link
 

Method Detail

addLink

public void addLink(LinkIfc l)
             throws java.lang.Exception
That method is used to create a new connexion between the IOPorts and a link. An IOPorts belongs to the Sensor, whereas the Links is the outside world

Parameters:
l - the Link to connect to
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if the connexion is impossible

writePacket

public void writePacket(PacketIfc p)
That methods is called by the sensor when he wants to write the next packet on the link

Parameters:
p - the packet to send

getPackets

public void getPackets()
That methods treats all incoming packets on the link. Each available packet (on each entry of the port) is enqueued on the sensor waiting queue. If the queue is full, the packet is destroyed
